repnme.cdata!:
Kazakhstan - Public Sector Resource
            Management Adjustment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely, with substantial
            institutional development impact. Lessons drawn from the
            project address primarily, the importance of realistic
            reform targets, even if they are ambitious, for they provide
            the stimulus for government reform support, commitment, and
            wider participation in structural adjustment lending.
            Likewise, appropriate counterpart in terms of scope, and
            level of authority, is particularly important, since it
            provides the highest, and continuous political support. But
            reform program actions should be based on execution, with
            specific control by local authorities, to provide the
            benefit of timely budgeted allowances. Furthermore,
            extensive, and specialized technical assistance (TA) is
            necessary to implement institutional reforms, because not
            only, changes in systems, and processes are required, but
            because reforms are difficult to implement, complex, and
            time-consuming, and, most importantly, TA provides the
            professional skills required in a changing environment. This
            cannot be achieved without responsive donor partners, whose
            assistance, and effectiveness proved critical in the
            provision of a timely, and high-quality TA.

19432559.trustfund:
TF032715-KAZAKHSTAN - SECOND STRUCTURAL
            ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF033556-KAZAKHSTAN - STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT,TF035751-KAZAKSTAN - PUBLIC SECTOR
            RESOURCE MANAGEMENT

repnme.cdata!:
Kazakhstan - Public Sector Resource
            Management Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Sector Resource Management
            Adjustment Loan conforms to, and is a part of, the Bank
            Group's assistance strategy for Kazakhstan outlined in
            the "Country Assistance Strategy Memorandum." The
            focus is on four areas: 1) sustaining private sector-led
            growth; 2) restructuring agriculture; 3) rehabilitating
            basic physical infrastructure; and 4) mitigating
            transitional poverty and promoting social service
            sustainability. The first tranche will be released soon
            after the loan becomes effective. The second tranche will be
            released by: 1) discontinuing budgetary support for
            identified agencies; 2) resolving inconsistencies between
            the civil service census and payroll lists; 3) enacting the
            new law on state procurement and enabling regulations; 4)
            eliminating pension fund arrears; 5) setting up a database
            of all investments proposed by ministries and local
            governments; 6) revising tariff regulations in the power
            sector and for communal services; 7) revising utility and
            housing subsidies; 8) implementing agreed-to technical
            assistance programs; and 9) all measures consistent with a
            Bank recapitalization plan. The following actions will
            trigger the release of the third tranche: 1) privatizing or
            liquidating certain entities; 2) enacting new civil service
            laws and/or regulations; 3) implementing procedures to award
            publicly-financed contracts; 4) containing the arrears of
            the central and local governments within agreed amounts; 5)
            publishing an audit report in the official gazette; 6)
            making the Public Investment Program (PIP) consistent with
            the external debt program and with the estimated future
            macroeconomic framework; and 7) conforming tariffs for
            heating and electricity to be consistent with revised regulations.
